wikipedia_page.main:
Gerald Rex Parsons (born 26 January 1934) is a former English cricketer. He was a right-handed batsman and right-arm off-break bowler who played for Cornwall.
Parsons, who played Minor Counties cricket for the Cornwall from 1966–1973, made his only List A appearance during the 1970 Gillette Cup, against Glamorgan.  Opening the batting and captaining the side, he made six runs before being bowled by Malcolm Nash.
